resources.string: Touch this button to show a color chooser screen for the background color and opacity of the widget.
Touch this button to show a color chooser screen for the text color of the %1s.

This screen provides sliders to set the hue, saturation, value, red, green, blue, and opacity values of the color of the widget\'s background. You can also type in values for any of these except the hue.
This screen provides sliders to set the hue, saturation, value, red, green, and blue components of the color of the %1s\'s text. You can also type in values for any of these except the hue.
Move the thumb on this slider to set the hue. This will not modify the value or saturation. Black, white and grayscale colors have a saturation of zero, so changing their hue will have no effect.

Move the thumb on this slider to set the saturation. This will not modify the hue or the value. Decreasing the saturation increases the amount of white in the color: pale pink is unsaturated, while pure red is saturated.

Move the thumb on this slider to set the value. This will not modify the hue or the saturation. The value is approximately the brightness of the color, but we use different names for some low-value colors: for example low-value red is brown.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of red in the color.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of green in the color.
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of blue in the color.
Touch this button to show a color chooser screen for the color of the full screen clock.
